Interface CPU

public interface CPU

A CPU object records the currently executing process, the number of context switches that have occurred during execution, and provides for simulated execution of processes.

Version:
8/3/15
Author:
Stephan Jamieson.

Method Summary
 ProcessControlBlock contextSwitch(ProcessControlBlock process)
          Switch the current process out and the given process in.
 ProcessControlBlock currentProcesss()

          Execute the current process in user space for the given number of time units.
 ProcessControlBlock getCurrentProcess()

          Determine whether the CPU is idle (currentProcess()==null).
 

Method Detail

contextSwitch

ProcessControlBlock contextSwitch(ProcessControlBlock process)
Switch the current process out and the given process in.

Returns:
the previously executing process.

currentProcesss

ProcessControlBlock currentProcesss()
Obtain the PCB of the currently executing process

execute

int execute(int timeUnits)
Execute the current process in user space for the given number of time units. If the current cpu burst can complete in the given time, then the CPU will execute the next instruction in the 'program'. This must be a system call (either I/O or terminate). Either will cause this process to be switched out. The CPU will update the system timer to indicate the amout of user time spent processing. The method returns the quantity of unused time unit. A value greater than zero means that the current cpu burst was completed. A value of zero means the current cpu burst may or may not have completed.

Returns:
number of unused time units.

getCurrentProcess

ProcessControlBlock getCurrentProcess()
Obtain the currently executing process.

isIdle

boolean isIdle()
Determine whether the CPU is idle (currentProcess()==null).
